PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines module¶

Module containing the the general routines for processing of conduction matrices with IO current arrays.

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.build_IO_currents_array(IO_index_pair, shape)[source]¶

from a set of two indexes, builds and returns the np array that will be taken in by a solver to recover the voltages

Parameters:
  • shape – shape of the conductance matrix
  • IO_index_pair – pair of indexes that represent the input/output nodes(indifferently)
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.get_better_pairwise_flow(conductivity_laplacian, idxlist, cancellation=True, memoized=False, memory_source=None)[source]¶

Performs a pairwaise computation and summation of the

Parameters:
  • memory_source – dictionary of memoized tension and current flow through the circuit
  • conductivity_laplacian – Laplacian representing the conductivity
  • idxlist – list of the indexes acting as current sources/sinks
  • cancellation – if True, the conductance values that are induced by single nodes interactions will be cancelled.
Returns:

current matrix for the flow system
Returns:

current through each node.
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.get_current_matrix(conductivity_laplacian, voltages)[source]¶

Recovers the current matrix based on the conductivity laplacian and voltages in each node.

Parameters:
  • conductivity_laplacian –
  • voltages –
Returns:

matrix where M[i,j] = current intesity from i to j. Antisymmetric, if current i->j : coeff is positive, else coeff is negative.
Returns:

matrix where M[i,j] = current intesity from i to j. Triangular superior, if current is from j to i, term is positive, otherwise it is negative.
Return type:

scipy.sparse.lil_matrix
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.get_current_through_nodes(non_redundant_current_matrix)[source]¶
Parameters:non_redundant_current_matrix – non-redundant (i.e. triangular superior) matrix of currents through a conduction system

:return : current through the individual nodes based on the current matrix as defined in the get_current_matrix module :rtype: numpy.array

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.get_current_with_reach_limitations(inflated_laplacian, Idx_pair, reach_limiter)[source]¶

Recovers the current passing through a conduction system while enforcing the limitation on the directionality of induction of the GO terms

Parameters:
  • inflated_laplacian – Laplacian containing the UP-GO relations in addition to purelyu GO-GO relations
  • Idx_pair – pair of indexes between which we want to compute the information flow
  • reach_limiter – list of indexes to which we want to limit the reach
Returns:
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.get_pairwise_flow(conductivity_laplacian, idxlist, cancellation=False, potential_dominated=True)[source]¶

Performs a pairwaise computation and summation of the

Parameters:
  • potential_dominated – if set to True, the computation is done by injecting constant potential difference into the system, not a constant current.
  • conductivity_laplacian – Laplacian representing the conductivity
  • idxlist – list of the indexes acting as current sources/sinks
  • cancellation – if True, the conductance values that are induced by single nodes interactions will be cancelled.
Returns:

current matrix for the flow system
Returns:

current through each node.

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.get_voltages_with_solver(laplacian_solver, IO_array)[source]¶

A convinient solver wrapper to avoind calling all the time the Solver(IO_array) assignement routine

Parameters:
  • laplacian_solver – object being able to solve the condctance laplacian system for the currents outside the system
  • IO_array – array representing the currents between the nodes within the system and outside of the system
Returns:

potential in each node
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.laplacian_reachable_filter(laplacian, reachable_indexes)[source]¶

Modifies a laplacian matrix in a way so that only the elemetns that are reachable in the current iteration of flow computation are taken in account. Intended for the CO system computation.

Warning:The only current alternative is usage of LU instead of cholesky, which is computationally more difficult and also requires reach-dependent computation to

System Message: WARNING/2 (/home/ank/PycharmProjects/PolyPharma/PolyPharma/neo4j_analyzer/Conduction_routines.py:docstring of PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.laplacian_reachable_filter, line 5)

Field list ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.

get an in and out flow to different GO terms

Warning:

An alternative is the construction of the individual laplacian for each new application
Parameters:
  • laplacian – intial laplacian of directionless orientation
  • reachable_indexes – indexes that are reachable from the nodes for which we want to perform the computation.
Returns:

laplacian where all the lines and colums for terms that are not reachable are null.
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.sample_pairwise_flow(conductivity_laplacian, idxlist, resamples, cancellation=False)[source]¶

Performs sampling of pairwise flow in a conductance system.

Parameters:
  • conductivity_laplacian – Laplacian representing the conductivity
  • idxlist – list of the indexes acting as current sources/sinks
  • cancellation – if True, conductance values that are induced by single nodes interactions will be cancelled.
  • resamples – number of times each element in idxlist will be sample. A reasonable minimal is such that len(idxlist)*resamples < 20 000
Returns:

current matrix representing the flows from one node to the other. This flow is absolute and does not respect the Kirchoff’s laws. However, it can be used to see the most important connections between the GO terms or Interactome and can be used to compute the flow through the individual nodes.
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Conduction_routines.sparse_abs(sparse_matrix)[source]¶

Recovers an absolute value of a sparse matrix

Parameters:sparse_matrix – sparse matrix for which we want to recover the absolute
Returns:absolute of that matrix
